TextBubble1Text: DRILL DRILL DRILL FIRE IN E/R Boiler, B Class Fire Medium Size. ALL STATION ALL S/B at Muster Station
Chief engineer, Stop the E/R ventilation. Close the fuel supply V/V to stop engine, and operate emergency generator and emergency fire pump.
Rodger.
First engineer, Stop the electricity and fuel supply valve to engine room and come to muster station.
Second engineer, Operate the emergency generator and come to muster station.
3/E, Operate the emergency fire pump and come to muster station.
1/OLR close the engine room sky light, OLR-A close the fire damper, OLR-B close the funnel damper, OLR-C close the accommodation ventilator, and come to muster station.
Captain, all ventilators were closed. Fuel valve closed and engine stopped. Emergency generator and emergency fire pump were operated.|
Rodger.
Captain, How do you read me?
Good, I read you well.
Muster Station report, Total crew 17, navigational duty 3, now 14, sir.
Now we have medium size fire in engine room. Prepare the two personnel with fireman's outfit.
Copy, sir. We will prepare the two personnel with fireman's outfit.
Hose team, arrange the fire hose on scene, and cooling team, arrange the fire hose on both side of engine room. Hose team, report me when you are ready with form applicator.
Rodger copy.
Chief engineer, check the operation condition of emergency generator and emergency fire pump.
Rodger copy.
Now engine room fire is too big, cannot control.
Captain., Now engine room fire is out of control.
All crew escape from engine room. Chief officer take the roll call when fixed CO2 fire-fighting system is ready.
Rodger, All crew escape from engine room, prepare for fixed CO2 fire-fighting system.
Muster Station report, Total crew 17, navigational duty 3, now 14, sir.|||
Chief engineer, Check the E/R ventilation be closed again.
Rodger, I confirmed to shut all ventilation and ducts to engine room.
Operate the fixed CO2 fire-fighting system!
Rodger, the fixed CO2 fire-fighting system was released in engine room.
Now I suppose one hour has passed since we release the fixed CO2 fire-fighting system. It's time to check engine room fire condition.
Rodger.
Now engine room fire is too big, cannot control.
Captain., Now engine room fire is out of control.
All crew prepare to abandon ship drill.
